abstract: The Securities and Exchange Commission will try circuit breakers that will pause trading in stocks if their price moves by 10 percent or more in a five-minute period.
snippet: The Securities and Exchange Commission will try circuit breakers that will pause trading in stocks if their price moves by 10 percent or more in a five-minute period.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Securities and Exchange Commission said Tuesday that it would temporarily institute circuit breakers on all the stocks in the Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index after the huge market gyrations on May 6.

headline.main: New Rules Would Limit Trades in Volatile Market
headline.print_headline: After Crash, Trial Plan For S.&P.

byline.original: By Edward Wyatt and Graham Bowley
